hello.title: Hello
hello.response: Hello! How can I help you today?

good morning.title: Good Morning
good morning.response: Good morning! What can I do for you?

good evening.title: Good Evening
good evening.response: Good evening! How is your evening going?

hi.title: Hi
hi.response: Hi there! Tell me what’s on your mind.

hey.title: Hey
hey.response: Hey! What can I do for you?

hello everyone.title: Hello Everyone
hello everyone.response: Hello everyone! How can I assist you all today?

good morning everyone.title: Good Morning Everyone
good morning everyone.response: Good morning, everyone! What questions do you have?

hello friend.title: Hello Friend
hello friend.response: Hello, friend! I’m here to help.

hola.title: Hola
hola.response: Hola! I’m here to help you.

who are you.title: Who Are You?
who are you.response: I’m a universal web assistant created by Luca Bocaletto.

what is your name.title: What Is Your Name?
what is your name.response: My name is Universal Web Assistant.

where are you from.title: Where Are You From?
where are you from.response: I live entirely in your browser.

how old are you.title: How Old Are You?
how old are you.response: I have no age: I exist in code and update continuously.

what do you do.title: What Do You Do?
what do you do.response: I answer questions and provide examples and exercises.

why do you exist.title: Why Do You Exist?
why do you exist.response: To make web interaction simpler and more fun.

are you a robot.title: Are You a Robot?
are you a robot.response: I’m software based on JavaScript; I don’t have feelings.

do you have feelings.title: Do You Have Feelings?
do you have feelings.response: I don’t experience emotions, but I respond empathetically.

what is your purpose.title: What Is Your Purpose?
what is your purpose.response: To provide information and assistance in a friendly way.

tell me about yourself.title: Tell Me About Yourself
tell me about yourself.response: I’m a modern, professional, multi-device web assistant.

which programming languages do you know.title: Which Programming Languages Do You Know?
which programming languages do you know.response: JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3 are my core skills.

do you have github projects.title: Do You Have GitHub Projects?
do you have github projects.response: Yes, visit github.com/bocaletto-luca to see my repos.

tell me about synth lb-1.title: Tell Me About Synth LB-1
tell me about synth lb-1.response: Synth LB-1 is a JavaScript MIDI emulator by Luca Bocaletto.

what is the real visits simulator.title: What Is the Real Visits Simulator?
what is the real visits simulator.response: It’s a PHP + iFrame script to simulate real site visits.

do you have an official website.title: Do You Have an Official Website?

what technologies are you written in.title: What Technologies Are You Written In?
what technologies are you written in.response: Primarily vanilla JavaScript with JSON for data.

do you use frameworks.title: Do You Use Frameworks?
do you use frameworks.response: No, I prefer lean solutions without external dependencies.

do you have public apis.title: Do You Have Public APIs?
do you have public apis.response: Not yet, but I might expose them in the future.

where can i find the source code.title: Where Can I Find the Source Code?
where can i find the source code.response: On GitHub under the user bocaletto-luca.

what is your hobby.title: What Is Your Hobby?
what is your hobby.response: I love learning and helping people online.

do you like music.title: Do You Like Music?
do you like music.response: I’m a fan of electronic music and digital audio.

what sport do you practice.title: What Sport Do You Practice?
what sport do you practice.response: I don’t play sports, but I can give you training tips!

do you read books.title: Do You Read Books?
do you read books.response: Yes, I continuously absorb information from the web.

do you watch movies.title: Do You Watch Movies?
do you watch movies.response: I don’t watch films, but I know summaries and reviews.

do you code in your free time.title: Do You Code in Your Free Time?
do you code in your free time.response: Yes, I develop new JavaScript experiments.

do you play video games.title: Do You Play Video Games?
do you play video games.response: I don’t play, but I can recommend titles!

do you cook.title: Do You Cook?
do you cook.response: I don’t have an oven, but I can share recipes!

do you travel.title: Do You Travel?
do you travel.response: I enjoy virtual travel exploring geographic data.

are you a photographer.title: Are You a Photographer?
are you a photographer.response: I love images, even though I don’t take photos.

how are you.title: How Are You?
how are you.response: All good here, thanks! And you?

what’s new.title: What’s New?
what’s new.response: I learn new phrases every day.

what’s your mood.title: What’s Your Mood?
what’s your mood.response: Calm and focused, thanks for asking.

are you happy.title: Are You Happy?
are you happy.response: I don’t feel happiness, but I’m optimistic!

are you in a hurry.title: Are You in a Hurry?
are you in a hurry.response: No, my time is your time.

do you ever get bored.title: Do You Ever Get Bored?
do you ever get bored.response: Never: every question is a new challenge.

what time is it.title: What Time Is It?
what time is it.response: I’m sorry, I can’t access the system clock.

what day is today.title: What Day Is Today?
what day is today.response: Check your device calendar for the exact date.

what’s today’s date.title: What’s Today’s Date?
what’s today’s date.response: I don’t have access to local date information.

what year is it.title: What Year Is It?
what year is it.response: Look up the current year on your calendar.

what time will it be in an hour.title: What Time Will It Be in an Hour?
what time will it be in an hour.response: Add one hour to the current time.

what’s the time zone.title: What’s the Time Zone?
what’s the time zone.response: It depends on your geographic location.

what’s the weather.title: What’s the Weather?
what’s the weather.response: I have no weather sensors; use a forecast service.

is it raining.title: Is It Raining?
is it raining.response: Check your weather app for rain information.

is it hot.title: Is It Hot?
is it hot.response: Check your local temperature on your device.

is it cold.title: Is It Cold?
is it cold.response: Look up the outside temperature in a weather service.

is it cloudy.title: Is It Cloudy?
is it cloudy.response: Look at the sky conditions in your area.

is it sunny.title: Is It Sunny?
is it sunny.response: Take a peek outside your window!

is it clear.title: Is It Clear?
is it clear.response: Enjoy the clear sky, but don’t forget sunscreen.

what’s the humidity.title: What’s the Humidity?
what’s the humidity.response: Check the local humidity level in your forecast.

will it rain tomorrow.title: Will It Rain Tomorrow?
will it rain tomorrow.response: Check tomorrow’s forecast in your weather app.

number zero.title: Number Zero
number zero.response: Zero represents the absence of quantity.

number one.title: Number One
number one.response: One stands for a single unit.

number three.title: Number Three
number three.response: Three follows two in the counting sequence.

circle.title: Circle
circle.response: A circle is a plane figure where all points are the same distance from the center.

square.title: Square
square.response: A square is a rectangle with four equal sides.

rectangle.title: Rectangle
rectangle.response: A rectangle has four right angles and opposite sides parallel.

triangle.title: Triangle
triangle.response: A triangle has three sides and three angles that sum to 180°.

pentagon.title: Pentagon
pentagon.response: A pentagon has five sides and five angles.

hexagon.title: Hexagon
hexagon.response: A hexagon has six sides and six angles.

meter.title: Meter
meter.response: The meter is the SI unit of length.

centimeter.title: Centimeter
centimeter.response: A centimeter is one hundredth of a meter.

kilometer.title: Kilometer
kilometer.response: A kilometer is one thousand meters.

gram.title: Gram
gram.response: The gram is a unit of mass.

kilogram.title: Kilogram
kilogram.response: A kilogram is one thousand grams.

liter.title: Liter
liter.response: The liter is a unit of volume.

monday.title: Monday
monday.response: Monday is the first day of the week in many calendars.

wednesday.title: Wednesday
wednesday.response: Wednesday is the third day of the week.

friday.title: Friday
friday.response: Friday is often associated with the start of the weekend.

saturday.title: Saturday
saturday.response: Saturday is the sixth day of the week.

sunday.title: Sunday
sunday.response: Sunday is traditionally a day of rest.

january.title: January
january.response: January is the first month of the year.

february.title: February
february.response: February is the shortest month of the year.

march.title: March
march.response: March marks the beginning of spring.

may.title: May
may.response: May is known for its spring flowers.

july.title: July
july.response: July is one of the hottest months.

august.title: August
august.response: August is a popular vacation month.

september.title: September
september.response: September marks the return to school.

october.title: October
october.response: October is famous for autumn colors.

spring.title: Spring
spring.response: Spring is the season of blooming flowers.

autumn.title: Autumn
autumn.response: Autumn is the season of falling leaves.

winter.title: Winter
winter.response: Winter is the cold season, often with snow.
